content: the eris socks are a pair of textured socks knitted from the cuff down they feature a twisted ribbing cuff and a simple knit and purl motif worked around the leg and on the top of the foot the pattern includes two heel options charted and written instructions **yarn ** you will need 210 225 / 240 270 / 285 / 305 m 230 250 / 265 295 / 315 / 335 yds of fingering weight sock yarn note that these estimates correspond to a 9 cm 3 ½ leg length the sample used three different colours changing at even points along the sock using colour a for the cuff and about three quarters of the leg 2 ½ pattern repeats colour b for the rest of the leg the heel and the gusset decreases 3 pattern repeats colour c for most of the foot 3 pattern repeats colour a again for the rest of the foot and the toe 1 ½ pattern repeat to replicate this colour sequence you will need about 80 85 / 90 100 / 105 / 110 m 90 95 / 100 110 / 115 / 120 yds of colour a 50 55 / 60 70 / 75 / 85 m 55 60 / 65 80 / 85 / 95 yds of colour b and 80 85 / 90 100 / 105 / 110 m 90 95 / 100 110 / 115 / 120 yds of colour c the sample was knit using filcolana arwetta 210 m 230 yds / 50 g in 148 deep olive 202 teal and 254 coral **needles ** 2 25 mm us 1 circular needles or dpns or size required to get gauge **gauge ** 32 sts x 40 rnds per 10 cm 4 in stockinette stitch after blocking **sizes ** the pattern is written for a 58 62 / 66 70 / 74 / 78 stitch count 18 19 5 / 20 5 22 / 23 / 24 5 cm 7 7 ¾ / 8 8 ¾ / 9 / 9 ¾ finished circumference measure your foot at its widest point under the toes and choose a size with about 2 5 cm 1 negative ease **notions ** tapestry needle and scissors stitch markers row counter recommended **techniques used ** socks are knit cuff down twisted ribbing cuff textured stripes with garter stitch and 1/1 ribbing 2 heel options heel flap + gusset / german short row heel rounded toe with simple decreases grafting pattern includes charted and written instructions
